notes:
Issue #20 Nissan X-Trail 2002 J. Hallyday/R. Metge

The 24th edition of the Dakar was greeted by a teeming crowd that came to Arras, France for the race's send-off. The race continued through Spain, Morocco, Mauritania, and Senegal for a total of 2,460 miles.

French singer and actor Johnny Hallyday (born Jean-Philippe Smet), considered by some to be the French Elvis Presley, took part in the Dakar for the first time. In the singer’s own words, "It was a dream, my dream as a kid". He did not win any stages but did finish in 49th place in the car category.
